blocks.content: A Table helps template designers create a table formatted input element containing columns of different data types, giving a traditional spreadsheet structure to data. Each row of the Table is a new input iteration over the specified data types. They are especially useful to enter a large volume of information in a structured way, quickly.

points.text: Select the Table Step icon:
Choose where you want to put the Table Step in the orange bar below
Add Table text to the input field
Add different Input elements into the Table Step
Validate the Step by clicking the green tick:

blocks.caption:
Tables on the web
This template uses a Table to facilitate rapid input of gauge readings, visually presenting it in a way that gives a global overview and easily allowing the addition and editing of values on new and existing rows.

blocks.content: Tapping the fullscreen icon (when active) to the right of the table, opens the table in a larger view showing more columns and rows.
